website_summaries.verdict: This baby walker is multi-purpose, making it a kid and parent favorite. It's got all the bells and whistles at a reasonable price.
pros: Music, lights, and fun buttons and doors keep babies well entertained even before they start walking
Features 70 sing-along songs, music, sound effects, and fun phrases
Handle height is perfect for babies learning to walk
cons: There's traction on the back tires but may still slip on some hardwood floors

customer_reviews.title: My child was hurt by this..
customer_reviews.text: I would give 0 stars.. but this is for children learning to go from sitting to standing... And shouldn't fall apart easily because of such. Called and complained and I was told this toy would be removed because my daughter was hurt multiple times because of this.. DONT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: We love the toys and buttons on the front
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as an early Easter gift for our 8 month old, he’s been walking while holding onto furniture for a month now and we wanted something to help him be more mobile. We love the toys and buttons on the front, super simple but so far keeps our baby entertained. The pieces easily came together in under a minute & for this low of a price it’s definitely a quality toy. The wheels turn great and I love that you can lock the back wheels for a slower pace! Doesn’t have a lot of weight to it, but doesn’t seem to be a big issue. Here’s a clip of our son playing with it the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Melendrez

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after bubba was already pulling up and cruising along furniture so didn't get the opportunity for it to grow with her. She really seems to like it and has spent a lot of time playing and pushing it. Has lots of little toys to push and pull on. I appreciate the volume control so the sounds don't drive you absolutely nuts. Our pediatrician told us that this was a good toy for her to have since it will help build core strength as she learns to walk. Assembly wasn't bad, but I was attempting to put it together on the bed and it works much better to have a hard surface to snap the legs down.
customer_reviews.author: RK A

customer_reviews.title: Entertains well.
customer_reviews.text: Welcome to our learning farm. We have lots to show you! If you love having kids toy sayings stuck in your head this is the toy for you, lol. My daughter has had this toy since about 6 months. She's seemed entertained by it for the last few months. We took the sound board off until recently. She's learning to stand now so she isn't quite using the walker part yet. The wheels are not the best in the slow mode, but you get what you pay and for that the whole toy is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Becca14

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Toy!!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this sit-to-stand learning walker to our 1-year-old nephew and he loves it! He was just starting to walk while hanging on to furniture and things, but with this toy he can walk quite well on his own. He looks so cute just marching along with a little tune playing and he has a big smile on his face! It’s a big help and I’m sure hid parents will soon be cursing our names as he goes further and further with it! 😉
customer_reviews.author: Fred S.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loved using this when she was just learning to walk, at about ~10 months. She occasionally plays with it even now at 19 months. The songs are annoying as with many of these toys with sounds but it was worth it to see how much fun she had with this. There are more things to do on this than on the cheaper walkers but both entertained her. In my mind, the big advantages of the VTech are (1) the slower speed setting for the wheels, which is nice on hard flooring for kids just learning to walk and (2) the phone, which is a lot of fun for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson when he was starting to walk. His other grandma got something like this for him too. However we noticed this one has two setting so it won't roll as fast when they are just starting out. The other one had nothing like this so it would get away from him. This one also has the option for the learning center to be removed which was great before he started walking. I just would set it on the floor or on the coffee table for him.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: The phone was missing and there is a piece of wrapping paper stuck to the box. This was supposed to be a brand new item. Now it’s questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and while she enjoys some of the features, the Do-Re-Me-Fa-So keys broke within a month and wont play any sounds. The music jumps around a lot, sounds like there is possibly some bad internal wiring. She has only used it a couple dozen times and she is pretty gentle so I doubt she was able to do any damage to it.
customer_reviews.author: Capricaa

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Durable.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old loves this. It helped her to take her first step. I have been so disappointed by fisher price quality. I will always seek out vtech now. Didn't give it 5 stars only because I wish the wheels had a lock position. She loves to sit and play with it on the stand but it moves. Great feature that the toy comes completely off. Even her older cousins are having fun with it. And it holds up. Thanks for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Holden

customer_reviews.title: Essential baby toy!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my daughter 9 years ago. It was such an amazing toy for her, I bought it recently for my nephew’s first birthday. It’s so entertaining, we often traveled with the detachable front piece when there wasn’t room for the whole walker. Other toys weren’t needed. It kept her occupied for hours. It’s an essential baby/toddler toy. It’s also great for children who are almost walking to gain confidence and get around on their feet until they’re ready to let go. I can’t say enough great things about this toy!
customer_reviews.author: I Am Sam

customer_reviews.title: Essential Toy for Aspiring Walkers 😂
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been a favorite for our child since before he could walk. Now as a two year old, he still plays with it and loves matching the shapes, and learning his colors and numbers and animal sounds with this toy. It has helped him so much when he was learning to walk. I would buy this again if I had another kid.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Barrera

customer_reviews.title: My baby was walking with it as soon as we gave it to him!
customer_reviews.text: This walker is great! Our baby really took to this. He was getting pretty good and standing by himself without holding onto anything, but this really helped him take the next steps. I have hardwood floors and it was pretty easy to set so that it didn't slide away from him. Within minutes he was walking all over the house with this walker. He doesn't really use the activity side as much, but this was by far his favorite Christmas present!
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have this Walker :)
customer_reviews.text: My son is 14months old, he loves to walk so mostly he likes to play with it as a stroller pushing and running with it. Yes he likes it but it's way to short for his height, if there were some height adjustment it would be great. My son loves to play the music, loves that tiny phone he like to talk on it all the time and keep playing with them it makes him engaged when am around with him. I gave 4 starts because he gets busy playing with V-tech walker for 15mins only.
customer_reviews.author: Suggu

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for helping your child begin to walk.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to our granddaughter. She was crawling at the time and could stand up if she held on to something. We set the wheels to the lower tension. She grabbed the handle bar and took off like jet. There are so many lights, gadgets and music playing she was a happy camper. After 2 months it’s still her favorite toy. It’s also very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Warning though, we bought this early. At one ...
customer_reviews.text: Warning though, we bought this early. At one year's old he took off fast on a hard wood floor and tried to take a corner and it allowed him too quickly and since he was learning how to walk still a bit, he took a spill hard on his head, real hard. He screamed for a long time. We put it away for a few months. Now at 18 months old, it's not really to teach him how to walk because he can run, but he loves pushing this around and playing with the front of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for learning to walk, batteries last forever
customer_reviews.text: My ten month old was on the verge of walking, not quite there, but she could take steps. We got her this toy to help her practice and she started walking completely on her own within a month. She still plays with it from time to time, but she doesn't need anything. It seems built to last a long time, and the batteries last forever. We've had it for four months now, and never needed to change the batteries once.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bulger

customer_reviews.title: Missing Piece and Wrong Color
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old loved this toy immediately. Two problems though: 1. the company sent me the wrong color (lavender instead of the orange which is what I actually ordered. I like the lavender better anyway so I’ll keep it) 2. The toy was missing piece. I see from photos that there is supposed to be a phone attached and this one did not come with a phone. I don’t want to go through the trouble of returning so I guess we will live without =\ rated 3 stars instead of 4/5 due to these two issues
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany S

customer_reviews.title: Overall great minor complaints
customer_reviews.text: Overall my child loves her learning walker. Two issues I find though. The first, while there are two “speeds” to set the walker too there is no break for wheels which can make it hard sometimes standing without rolling forward. Second. There is something odd about the recording of the saying that occurs when you turn the gears. Ours says “The flowers SHIN in the sun” not I assume SHINE
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: super happy. Second this was super cute and affordable ...
customer_reviews.text: To start off it had batteries and was able to be used right away i mean so impressed you have to know how frustrating it is when a kid sees a gift and you forget or dont have them .. super happy . Second this was super cute and affordable and is built very well. third I love that the wheels have to stages for starters and already walkers. would buy for other mommies for baby showers.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria /Eric R

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel comfortable having him play with this without me right next ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this but its front brakes don't work well so it makes me nervous when he tries to stand up on it (and it always rolls or slides out from under him). I don't feel comfortable having him play with this without me right next to him. Also, the phone is not connected to the base and is already lost.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for baby development!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent but! My 10 month old twins absolutely love it and are using it as intended. I love that the interactive face comes off as a ground toy. My daughter has even started to push and walk with it! So for me this did exactly as described, and I am a very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Roundy

customer_reviews.title: Good Walker for Baby
customer_reviews.text: I like this learning walker and my 11-month old baby loves it and plays with it all the time. When he gets tired, he will sit down and play with the lights and shapes. After a few minutes, he will stand up and walk with it again! Great design and good taste of the music.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Our granddaughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our granddaughter about a month ago (around 9 months old) and it is her favorite thing to play with. It has helped her to learn how to stand up and now we're working on the "walking" part!! The product was in great condition and arrived right on time!
customer_reviews.author: M. Philipp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for learning to walk and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece when she was just learning to walk. She is now almost 3 and still uses the activity console without the walker. I should have reviewed it a long time ago but better late than never. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: CMoZRo

customer_reviews.title: 40 in 4 flat .
customer_reviews.text: After a serious injury this great little therapy device taught me how to walk again! Can you believe it ? If it can help me a man who could not walk @ all to now I run a 40 in 4 flat it will absolutely give your toddler a great head start ! Leaving other todd’s In the dust . Be a proud parent and invest in this .
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Good product for babies!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my niece a few years ago, she loved it. Bought again for my own daughter who is almost one, and she loves it too! Lots of buttons and music, the little phone on it is really cute. She now picks it up and put it next to her ear pretending she is calling someone!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Got decent use out of the front play panel, but totally worthless as a walker. Our 11 month old is a strong crawler and can stand, on the brink of walking, and this thing just flies out in front of her...it’s just not that stable for walking. Maybe if you had a really think rug, or used it on grass...but normal floors/rugs, no bueno. Almost dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Arentowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson loves his new toy! He was delayed as far as being mobile at 13 months. I gave him this, and he is all over the place. Awesome! better than a traditional walker. He doesn't have the option to sit, so he just keeps going and going. LOL! He'll be running in another week or so... tee hee
customer_reviews.author: Wife of Ellijiah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grow into toy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item when my son was 7 months old. The front is detachable and turns into a little flat activity table which was perfect for him at that age. Now, 3 months later, he is actually using it as a true walker! It's very sturdy and has made it through numerous wall crashings! The wheels can be adjusted for smoother turning or For slower walkers. Good for carpet, tile, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Middleton Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, but make sure it works properly
customer_reviews.text: Great product that my son loved to play with (8 months old) but it was broken within a week of light use. Interactive bit was never dismounted from walker and for some reason it just stopped working. Was given a refund for defective item by Amazon and bought another, but would have thought that the QC would have been better on the first one. Good toy, poor QC or workmanship from factory though.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Holt

customer_reviews.title: Best toy! Definitely recommend. A favorite for many months!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best toys I purchased for my grandson. It is a FAVORITE! When he was not yet crawling, he enjoyed pushing the buttons and loved the music. He learned to walk holding on to this and practicing. When he was walking, it was taken on his first outside walk. Even at 17 months he uses it almost daily. (It has a permanent home in our living room!) Great purchase. Definitely recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Q

customer_reviews.title: My Baby's Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. My daughter has used this since about 6 months old. She is perfectly happy to sit on the floor and play with it. She's now starting to pull up and loves to try and pull up on it. I love that it has "brakes" on the back that can allow the wheels to go faster or slower. The music is not as annoying as some loud children's toys. It's my baby's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hargett

customer_reviews.title: Buy This!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product 10 Stars I would. My 11 month old loves it and the battery operated portion of it does so many things to keeps her entertained. The Walker part of it works as described and I would definitely recommend this product. I've had it for several months now and my daughter has dropped it, smashed it into things and stood on it, and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Product is exactly as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as expected! Packaged well. My daughter will be a year in just a couple days and she loves this toy! All the noises especially the door where it says " peek-a-boo I see you"! Great vibrant colors and the perfect hieght for walking behind! Need to be careful if giving a wipe down tho I didn't realize there were stickers on the roll things and I ripped the sticker slightly..right after putting it together 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Fun and encourages walking!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. She loves to use it to stand up with. I love that the wheels have the different levels of resistance to them. Her favorite part is the peekaboo part, but she also likes to try to chew on the handle and dance to the barn yard music. The assembly was simple but took a bit more strength than I have in my hands. Husband had to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for babies
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this toy when they learned to sit and when learning to walk. The walker has wheel locks so a beginner walker can take it slow and the light up section comes off so you can lay it flat which is really nice. My son loved opening and closing the little barn door over and over. Also there are two volume settings so it keeps the noise level down
customer_reviews.author: LuckyD

customer_reviews.title: VTech Sit to Stand Learning Walker is Great learning toy that kids will love
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the V Tech Sit to Stand learning walker for my one year old grandson and he loved it. He couldn’t quite walk when he received it, but within a couple weeks he was up pushing it around. He loved the noises and learned how it worked pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Peele

customer_reviews.title: Good for early walkers
customer_reviews.text: My daughters loves the music and lights on this board. The phone is dumb though because it doesn't have a cord so it just falls off all the time. We have hard wood floors so it is definitely slick and will slide away from her if she puts too much weight on it. I would love it they made the wheels more grip-y.
customer_reviews.author: Catie M

customer_reviews.title: Our 9 mo old likes it, but...
customer_reviews.text: The sounds and play options are great! The tractions slips easily. She barely uses it for walking because she did fall with it a couple of times, so she avoids it for that purpose now. She does still play with it though and it brings smile to her face
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Grandson’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a baby shower gift for my niece. My grandson received one and it was his favorite toy. from 4-12 months. The person that gave it to him said it was HER little one’s favorite toy as well. Little ones live it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Braun

customer_reviews.title: ... walker has “speed” adjustments on the wheels which is great for a semi-walking baby
customer_reviews.text: This walker has “speed” adjustments on the wheels which is great for a semi-walking baby. The entertainment area is a bit distracting but it is removable which is great. The only thing that I can say for improvement is that the legs do not fold in, which I suppose is a good thing. But, it makes it a bit tedious to take it apart. Otherwise, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: YS

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this walker! She is 8 months and loves to push it all around the house every single day! We enjoy having the ability to slow the wheels down so she can keep up, too! I HIGHLY recommend this to all parents!
customer_reviews.author: The Laven Family

customer_reviews.title: Convenient & versatile!
customer_reviews.text: It is NOT hard to put together at all. I just didn’t read the instructions LOL. This toy is awesome! Penny started standing as soon as we got it. She loves pulling on the shapes and they are pull-string attaches so they never get lost (yay)! We detached the actual toy from the walker when traveling to visit family and it entertained her in the car as well. Super convenient and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My little one is only 5 month so he can't walk but he still enjoys playing with this walker. He enjoys opening the peekaboo door and watching the lights blink! I can't wait until he starts walking with this walker!
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Best money every spent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this toy for months now and my child still plays with it! There are so many activities and songs on this, it took a while to keep uncovering different things it would do with songs, colors, the phone attached, playing the do re mi fa so la game and so on! Plus it’s perfect for when your baby wants to start walking too. I’m in a moms group and every mom raves about this toy! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for a one year old!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my nephew, for his first birthday! It was a hit! Thankfully we were able to dial down the wheels, to add resistance! The first time he tried it, he took off, and it took off faster! Once we changed the resistance, it was perfect. He loves it. Pushed it all over the place, giggling the whole time! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andra Myers

customer_reviews.title: My favorite push toy
customer_reviews.text: I love that with this model the handle is wide enough to give the toddler great balance. I also love that the back wheels have two speed settings so that learning toddlers don’t put their weight on the toy and it zoom out from underneath them. This push toy is my absolute favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but smiles
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my granddaughter and as you can see it’s right in the middle of everything else because she pushed the others away! Great service and very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Sower

customer_reviews.title: Multiple uses at different ages
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this! He uses it while on tummy, in sitting, and once he can walk and stand he will use it for that. Definitely worth the price for all the options you have with it. It also has different noise settings, which is important because I don't always want kids music blasting through my entire home.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: your baby will love this, it's very helpful for your baby to start walking, we bought this for a friend and their baby loved it, and then we bought it for my nephew and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Buy It For Your Baby
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves to use this as a toy and walker. It's great that the table top comes off so baby can play with it while sitting. Then, she takes the walker and zoom all over the house. The two speeds on the walker helps her move with control at the beginning and then cruise faster as she for more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J.Bermeo

customer_reviews.title: A favorite at our house
customer_reviews.text: This walker is by far one of the favorite toys. When my son was learning to walk it provided stability to get his footing and empower him to move. Now he races it around and giggles as the music plays. It’s nice to see it keeps his attention - we didn’t know after he began walking but it’s used daily for over a year! Well worth the money to me!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Polzini

customer_reviews.title: Early walker
customer_reviews.text: Got it because it had excellent reviews. My baby walked at 10 months (not sure how much this played a role in that) but my first 2 didn't walk until after 1 yr. It is very sturdy on carpet and linoleum, wheels adjust for speed, doesn't flip easy. Has fun toys, plays music while walking to encourage baby. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: great buy for babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: we received this as a gift and it has been great! I strongly believe that it helped my little guy learn to walk quicker... not always a good thing! but the front of it is very interactive as well even after they don't need it to walk. My son loves the phone and the cow door. I have purchased this as gifts and everyone loves them!
customer_reviews.author: TiffyK

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for pre-walker and Walker...loves to push it around while music is playing!
customer_reviews.text: This was my grandsons favorite toy when he came to see us...still loves it but now he’s loving other things too. Best part is that the music/interactive part comes off from the wheels and it entertains him in the car...so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen A. DiPietro

customer_reviews.title: but other than that this is a great toy! The little shapes are attached by strings ...
customer_reviews.text: The purple phone does not stay attached, but other than that this is a great toy! The little shapes are attached by strings at the top so they cant be lost. It has the typical off, low, high volume feature and plays a few songs and talks to your child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it, you will slowly lose your mind listening to the same songs over and over.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: My kid loves this thing. The two parts usually end up separated but together or individually, my one year old thinks this is a ton of fun. Con: Why the hell did I buy another thing that makes so much noise?! And sometimes my toddler will stand on the separated interactive piece and try to climb over the side of his play pen.
customer_reviews.author: FoodLady

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy
customer_reviews.text: So cute! Our 8 month old granddaughter loves it! She sits to play now and loves the phone receiver. It’s nice to have a toy with some longevity as it will take her through to walking. Songs are cute but not annoying.
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for my nephew, & he ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my nephew, & he was walking with it the very next day! Yay! 1st time walking while supported. Also, my sister recieved 3 variations of this type of toy but decided to keep this one bc of the speed control and different educational/developmental aspects.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Aleman

customer_reviews.title: My 1  year old son loves this
customer_reviews.text: My son used this when he was crawling as an activity/ entertainment..then he started to stand and would use it for help balancing .. now he walks with it and i love how there are settings on the little wheels to make it safer for little ones that aren’t quite ready to walk quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen G

customer_reviews.title: An all-around great infant and toddler toy
customer_reviews.text: This has quickly become our little dude's favorite toy! And aside from the incessant jingle (which my husband and I now have memorized), it's one of our favorite toys for him, too! There are two different modes, learning vs. musical, and the walker wheels can be adjusted to a faster or slower roll. Honestly, I could go on and on about all of the bells and whistles, but this is overall a great toy that will continue to be played with a lot in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Denae L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Immediate use and delight.
customer_reviews.text: It was immediately usable. My 9 month old grandson both lived all the sounds and things that moved, but he loved pushing it to walk, since he is not quite there on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter just loves this. She is currently 10 months old and is walking. She uses this all the time to push around until she runs it into something. She loves all the sounds and light the board has, and it can be detached. I feel it is one of her favorite go to toys.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: This is great fun for my little guy. His favorite part in the phone. I gave it 3 stars because the lock setting could use more traction to prevent it from moving.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbirdsings

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get the Grandbaby to walk on his own. Without noticing, he was playing with this toy and was walking. So cute and funny
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT toy for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Baby boy Grandson number 13 loves it! Lots of activities that keep his attention. I have always marveled how toddlers will crawl past two dozen toys to get into something that they shouldn't. This on actuall keeps his attention!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Also another resistance setting for the wheels would be nice. A plus is that it arrived with batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old loves the activity panel. She can't quite use the walker yet but will soon. There are 2 resistence settings for the wheels. Would be 5 stars if the phone had a connecting string.... but it may be a safety issue. Also another resistance setting for the wheels would be nice. A plus is that it arrived with batteries installed. Great buy. This is my daughter's current favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice activity center, improve the walker
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it, very entertaining and engaging. Would like to have more granular control over the speed of the wheels and it does skids in certain floor types like ceramic, I guess wheels need to be from different material. Never leave your child alone.
customer_reviews.author: Achtopa

customer_reviews.title: Fun while you learn.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter enjoyes this. It helps her to get around and be independent. She keeps her balance as she pushes it, and it is helping her to learn to walk. I think it is great the the front piece is detachable, and she can play with it any where. I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MJA

customer_reviews.title: It also seems like the phone should be connected because its easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this toy, but after a few minutes the sound worked only intermittently. The lights would still flash but noise would cut in and out. It also seems like the phone should be connected because its easy to lose, but for some reason it wasn't designed this way.
customer_reviews.author: KateKay

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy for my kid to walk with. On a carpet floor, the walker is safe. I’m not sure how much safe is it, on a wood floor.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY JOHN MATHEW

customer_reviews.title: The toy is fun for my son because the front has a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: The toy is fun for my son because the front has a lot going on so it keeps him busy, but it's not good for walking. It moves too fast even though you can lock the back wheels. The handle is too close to the toy too so he steps and trips on it. It's a good toy because it has fun things on it, but if you're looking for something for your child to learn to walk, I wouldn't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: ... really engage with this but now it's becoming his favorite toy. He is using it to climb up ...
customer_reviews.text: It took a few days for my little guy to really engage with this but now it's becoming his favorite toy. He is using it to climb up and stand. You really can't leave him alone with it because its not solid enough to allow him to pull up by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy Lucca

customer_reviews.title: VTech sit-to-stand learning walker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grand daughter for her first birthday she loves it. Plays with it all the time it was a great buy. Would buy again and would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandson's first Christmas. 10 months old. Loves the activity front. He is now 11 months old and is walking around like a race car driver behind the walker, do cute!
customer_reviews.author: Marie R Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old grandson loves this. You can remove it from the piece with wheels. Can't wait for him to start using the wheel part to help him walk! I definitely recommend this and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn B

customer_reviews.title: V tech toys are really good quality
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this toy, he plays with it a great deal. He loves all of the V tech toys we have bought for him.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Best money I have ever spent
customer_reviews.text: Best money I have ever spent. He played with it non stop as soon as I put it together. He was about ten months when I purchased. He's almost 14 months now and still plays with it. Not as often as he did originally, but he does still play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this. She has had it for a couple months now and it is her favorite. She is now 9 months so she uses it to walk around. If your considering buying, I highly recommend! I also think the price is so reasonable for what your getting
customer_reviews.author: Justin Koschara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy.  This made a big hit on Christmas Day.
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old grandaughter LOVES this. She was just starting to walk and this toy has accelerated the process. She also loves all of the fun gadgets on th front.
customer_reviews.author: Capromeryx

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this and I come to find out after going to three packs of batteries that is defective it does not work my 10-month-old son is not very happy because it doesn’t light up or do what it supposed to do I’m very upset now now I have to go through the whole process of returning it and waiting for another one I don’t think this should be happening
customer_reviews.author: Thank you very

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Helps kids with balance as they learn how to walk and keeps them busy when they’re not.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Howard

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining but ugly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ugly as hell but the babies like it (starting around 8 months). It lights up and makes noise. One star removed because the purple phone keeps getting thrown across the room and lost... It should have been tethered.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot for your baby to do, I even play with it I will confess. The play is portable and it comes off the stand to be carried away once your baby is mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Diva

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this when my baby was 6 months old. She is now 9 months old & still loves this! There are two different settings for the activities and two for volume. I love that you can remove the activity part from the walker part for more fun!
customer_reviews.author: Liz R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Come well packaged. Super easy to install. Everything as expected. My daughter was entertain the minute I opened it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Gurrola

customer_reviews.title: Fun and interactive!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to assemble, and fun! The best part is watching my lo walk around the house with this, so stinking adorable!!!! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute for playing and standing, but uncomfortable for walking
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, baby likes to play with it. However it should be more wide on the back (between rare toy legs). It's uncomfortable for baby to make steps as her steps are wide and she is hitting the walker legs.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old loves it! She's been using it for a month or so and enjoys using it to walk all over the house! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: DY

customer_reviews.title: There's more to this toy than teaching colors and shapes.
customer_reviews.text: This made such a wonderful gift! Such a creative toy! It covers so many aspects for a little one to learn besides colors, shapes and walking. Key words, such as 'off, on, piano keys, telephone, wheels, walk, spin, say hello (when picking up the telephone). It has been very helpful as a walker with the two different walking settings located in the rear wheels. Especially, when your little one is just learning how to walk, the walker moves along with your child's pace without having them slip forward with the correct wheel setting. My son is ready to make a VTech commercial anytime :)
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginner walkers, love the wheels lock an the overall design is strong an sturdy. Plenty of choices for my grandson to play with, bright colors and lights an sounds. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: swhite1294

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my 10 month old nephew. He loves playing with it so much his parents purchased the same one!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1yr old loves this thing! He pushes it around the house like it’s his little lawn mower/vacuum cleaner. We love that you can also remove the musical toy and play with it alone. It has saved us during car rides!
customer_reviews.author: AMc1029

customer_reviews.title: The only walking toy you’ll need.
customer_reviews.text: Mom of 4 here and I wish this had existed for my first two children! We had this walker for my 3rd and loved it but sold it in a rummage sale. We have been using a hand-me-down walker from a friend for our 4th but I wasn’t as excited about it as I am this one. Could not be more easy to put together. We’ve had this new one for less than 5 minutes and my 9 month old loves it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: AJane

customer_reviews.title: Learning Walker
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is 1 year and 2 months old. He loves this and learning to walk with this. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: JEFFERY FRANKLIN

customer_reviews.title: Fun and exciting for the little ones
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves this as she is starting to walk and the front peac easily comes off so that she can play with it in her crib, I do recommend locking the rear wheels if you have hardwood floors as my daughter started to run and scared me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year Old Baby Girls - Cool
customer_reviews.text: We like it. Not an all day think. Periodic toy, still not above our apple products, of course. Babies pick it up through the day so I got my money's worth. I personally like the various features. Educational. I like it. Thanks. Price is ehhh, but it's cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana Official

customer_reviews.title: the mechanism let's parent control speed. Very save
customer_reviews.text: IT is a great product. My 11 month old loves it and walks and runs all over the place with it. She still learning how to walk and/or run, but this helps greatly. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei Gil

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Must For Your Baby!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my 9 month old twin boys love! Music, sounds, lights. Eventually they will be walking with it and sometimes do! Package arrived in perfect condition with no damage, easy to assemble. Would for sure recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

product_meta.title: VTech Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker
product_meta.description:
Color:Orange| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFrom baby steps to big steps the Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker by VTech helps your baby develop from a crawler to a walker through adaptive technology. With a barnyard of playful friends to cheer them on, your little one will have endless fun as they learn to walk. Start out with the easy-to-remove activity panel for floor play or on-the-run fun, then step it up with the fun-to-maneuver walker. Spinning gears, five piano keys, three colorful rollers, three light-up shape sorters, three light-up buttons and a telephone handset offers endless fun that will stimulate your baby’s learning and develop their motor skills. The Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker keeps baby on track teaching shapes, colors, animals, music and more!

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From baby steps to big steps the Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker by VTech helps your baby develop from a crawler to a walker through adaptive technology. With a barnyard of playful friends to cheer them on, your little one will have endless fun as they learn to walk. Start out with the easy-to-remove activity panel for floor play or on-the-run fun, then step it up with the fun-to-maneuver walker. Spinning gears, five piano keys, three colorful rollers, three light-up shape sorters, three light-up buttons and a telephone handset offers endless fun that will stimulate your baby’s learning and develop their motor skills. The Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker keeps baby on track teaching shapes, colors, animals, music and more!

See more
feature_bullets: Interactive learning baby walker features a removable toddler play panel that develops fine motor skills
Early learning center has 5 piano keys that play music and encourage creativity; wheels work on carpeted and hard floors
Features 2 colorful spinning rollers, 3 shape sorters, and 3 light-up buttons that develop motor skills
Pretend telephone handset and mechanical elements enhance role-play fun; 2 AA batteries are included
Over 70 sing-along songs, music, sound effects and fun phrases; meant for babies and toddlers 9 months to 3 years old
